alert.note: Alert for Hill (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 26 at 6:02PM CDT until April 26 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Texas, including the following county, Hill. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water on roadways is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hillsboro, Whitney, Bynum, Carl`s Corner, Aquilla Lake, Lake Whitney, Abbott, Peoria, Woodbury, Mayfield, Lovelace and Osceola.
